result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by DA's Office. km

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela S or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:42 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekken with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Jeremy Jacob Schroeder in court, in custody. Attorney Amos appeared for Corp Counsel on behalf of St. Croix County Child Support Agency. DE confirms last known address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE qualifies for PD. Waive reading. NG. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Bond argument; bond ordered. Atty Amos states DE has a commitment in child support matter. gll
